website_summaries.verdict: An easy-to-use, durable and affordable cordless right angle drill.
pros: Extended multi-position handle offers tremendous versatility
Powerful motor provides at least 125 pounds of torque
Variable speed design delivers up to 1,500 RPM
cons: May stop working on its own after limited use, even at a low torque

customer_reviews.title: Works well once I read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought I had a bad drill because it wouldn't drill a 5/16" hole through softwood or drive a 1-1/2" #8 screw into softwood without stalling. I had completely overlooked the torque-limit setting because it is not located by the chuck as on most drill-drivers. And, since the torque-limiter on this drill is electronic the drill just stops when it reaches its limit and you don't get the buzzing sound you get from a friction clutch. Once I cranked up the torque setting, it has done everything I've asked of it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gober

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee 2615-20 M18 side drill
customer_reviews.text: I use many of the Milwaukee M18 tools, they are powerful, good battery time/life with good balance. When purchase this tool I was debating between the 12V and the 18V, the 12V version look slim, smaller, but to use 2 types of batteries is a hassle. I purchase the M18 tool. it works fine, but it is too big, and with the battery it will not fit into small places (and it was bought in order to be used in places that regular drill does not fit). another annoying feature is to pass between normal and reverse mode. the button is small and not contactable.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Great Right Angle Drill
customer_reviews.text: Added this drill to my Milwaukee tool set and have used it several times. This drill has plenty of power, handles well and is pretty straightforward to use. You do need to pay attention to the clutch setting which is a small rotary dial just above the battery on top of the unit. It uses the M18 battery line and has the standard led work light built in. No problems recommending this drill for tight quarter work.
customer_reviews.author: Big John

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like it .....even if I have pinched my fingers several times between the housing and the chuck. Lots of torque, but one has to learn to set the torque adjuster to whatever you need because if you don't the thing will just stop dead. They've made the trigger long enough so that whatever battery you're using you can get reasonable balance on the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Burnt up the second time I used it, I’m a Milwaukee guy all my tools are Milwaukee power and hand but this didn’t hold up to my standards. Don’t but Milwaukee needs to go back and try again on this drill very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not wimpy
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used it with a rotary brush for cleaning, but it has some torque. Not very speedy, but strong. I needed two hands to control it accurately, or it would've taken off without me. I don't care for the reverse switch being small and recessed, but no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: kram1961

customer_reviews.title: Brand New in a Box.  Plenty of Torque
customer_reviews.text: Drill came in a Millwaukee factory box. Is brand new. No battery thus the description "Tool Only". Used this to drill screws through 2" x 4"s. Zero issues with torque. There is a torque level dial setting. Need to set on high for drilling or high torque screw needs. Only thing I would improve is sensitivity of speed trigger. It's quite difficult to maintain very low speed vs. normal electric drill. I was on fence about buying this cause of reviews mentioning low torque. Torque is not an issue. Definitely recommend for anyone who needs to drill in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality and performance!
customer_reviews.text: Although I’ve only used it a few times so far it functioned flawlessly and it has more than adequate torque to drive 1” diameter wood drills through 2” studs. I’m very pleased with all my Milwaukee cordless power tools!
customer_reviews.author: brinde2

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you’re going to drill wood
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice drill. I’m a residential electrician and I bought to get into the tight spaces I’m always in but it lacks in power drastically. It can barely get through a 2x4 and I always bogs down and jams. It needs a lot more power and torque to be able to comfortably drill through wood.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Hogan-Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Why not a 1/2" chuck? It definitely has the ...
customer_reviews.text: Why not a 1/2" chuck? It definitely has the torque for it. A 1/2" chuck is necessary when using holesaws inside of microwave cabinets, that is if you do not want a blowout! I am a professional carpenter. ps. expect the fellas at work to ask to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: THIS GOT THE JOB DONE!
customer_reviews.text: I had to drill eight pilot holes to apply lag screws into some extremely tight spaces. This drill, with its short nose, allowed me to get the job done. When it really counts, I know I can depend on all of Milwaukee's Heavy Duty power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Cletus Bleeker

customer_reviews.title: OK tool bad reverse button
customer_reviews.text: Got this 1/18/16.....have lots of M18 tools........haven't used this much yet, BUT......... 1st impression, reverse trigger requires second hand and small finger to engage. Unlike most drills where single hand op is easy and one handed. Seems under-powered @ 125 in #'s. My M18 drill is rated @500. LOVE all my other Milwaukee tools, but this unit leaves me a little disappointed. Can't give it 3.5 *, but it's not a 4 * to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. William D. Kern Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Drill came wrapped in plastic. No box no instructions and no warranty information. Have not opened plastic as I am contemplating returning the item. May even call Milwaukee to run the serial number and see if it is a legit product. Very disappointed. Will upload pic of packaging
customer_reviews.author: michael brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good, powerful, heavy
customer_reviews.text: It drills holes at a right angle, hence the name lol. For real the trigger is great and it's the same great quality as all the other milwaukee tools. The only thing I have to say is that the 18 volt is kind of heavy for cabinet work, I prefer to use m12 tools for finish work, and you aren't really going to use a right angle drill anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive, bulky
customer_reviews.text: Low speed, took forever to drill throughout 2x6 with a small hole saw. Used a lot of battery to drill 2 holes.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: This is not M18 when arrives
customer_reviews.text: After a LONG wait when arrived it was M12 inside M18 box!!! So disappointed Returned the wrong product
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my collection.
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Milwaukee M18 series of tools to be unsurpassed for battery life, overall durability, and usability. This angle drill does nothing to change my opinion. I have used two other brands of cordless right angle drills, and though each did the job, neither had the power of the Milwaukee, and the automatic light is a nice feature. Though it is heavier weight-wise than some, that is generally not a factor because it is rarely used for long periods of time. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: JTHandyman

customer_reviews.title: My least favorite Milwaukee M18 tool to date
customer_reviews.text: I love Milwaukee M18 tools but this o e was not thought out well for functionality as the chuckis too large in diameter therefore marking up inside corners.
customer_reviews.author: toddinnv

customer_reviews.title: New?  Not what I expect from a Milwaukee retailer.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Milwaukee tool fan but I was not happy when this arrived without any manual or warranty information. I don’t care that it was in a plain box and not in a retailer’s blister package but I expect to receive all the pertinent documents. How do I not know that this is not remanufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: It drills (at the right angle) well
customer_reviews.text: Great little guy for fitting in tight spots, not as torque-filled as a super hog, but for its size, does great.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It does its job
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for me. Perfect for drilling or driving screws it tight places.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Podurgiel

customer_reviews.title: Great product lots of power. I’m glad I purchase this
customer_reviews.text: Great product lots of power. I’m glad I purchase this
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: tight space drill driver
customer_reviews.text: the battery pack from my other M18 Fuel tools fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: exactly 3/8" max drill size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy tool for getting into tight spaces though I wish they made a 1/2" version in brush-less. We use 3/8" galvanized bolts which won't go through a 3/8" hole. This drill will not chuck down on anything bigger so we have to grind flats on our 25/64" bits.
customer_reviews.author: James Ryan Kuzilik

customer_reviews.title: Great for handyman and professional
customer_reviews.text: Never went wrong choosing Milwaukee products. Durable and powerful. Great for handyman and professional. Great torque for a cordless angle drill. Use caution! Hang on tight when in use or you can sprain your wrist when drill bit catches!
customer_reviews.author: Niklaus Imobersteg

customer_reviews.title: excellent right angle drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drill holes between rafters. Normally hard to reach with a traditional sized drill, this works really well. With a paddle bit it went quickly through 2x4 and 2x10's. The power settings are adjustable. This does not come with batteries but any other M18 battery will fit it without problems.
customer_reviews.author: T Brown

customer_reviews.title: Undecided!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the first time I used this drill, it stopped working. I plan to take it to the service center next week. Before it stopped working it was really liking the fact that it fit into such a tight space. The trigger was a bit touchy but it had plenty of torque! Let's see how the warrantee process is.
customer_reviews.author: Don Ingvardsen

customer_reviews.title: Weak weak weak
customer_reviews.text: This drill is very lacking in power, I bought it for the convienence of getting into tight places, but was very disappointed at the lack of power,
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Do not need it very often but does come in handy
customer_reviews.author: Steven Sowski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy....replaced an ancient nicad dewalt unit. Would have preferred brushless but this still works well for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: not really powerful
customer_reviews.text: not really powerful .basically used to open holes on 2x4 wall studs .it struggles to open a 1 inch hole on wood
customer_reviews.author: juana canoura

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little right angle drill. Good for tight spaces the regular one and impact gun don’t fit. Plenty of power to put screws in. 👍🏻 I definitely recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I've used it for small holes but it does not like drilling with wood bits over 3/4"
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I was wanting, is more of a right angle screw driver than a drill. Very weak compared to Milwaukee battery hammer drills. I've used it for small holes but it does not like drilling with wood bits over 3/4".
customer_reviews.author: Ala Al

customer_reviews.title: Functional yet weak.
customer_reviews.text: Works alright, would be better if it had a bit more torque. Stalls out too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Hard working, durable drill.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful drill. Easy to use right out of the box. After using it for a month, I keep it close by all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Souder

customer_reviews.title: Lots of drilling power here!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one powerful drill for its size and applications. It does a great job on the hard to get to places. It is easy to chuck up a bit or remove one. I like the feel of it when in use. I would recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great tool for tight places
customer_reviews.text: I had some shelves that I had to drill holes in for a computer holes are like three holes in about 6 inches of space no problem
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: All the tool and none of the fluff! Does ...
customer_reviews.text: All the tool and none of the fluff! Does exactly what its advertised to do gets in those tight spots and the chuck seems to hold quite well as long as you lock it after tightening.
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very strong a little on the heavy side comes in handy in tight places
customer_reviews.author: alexander f wojcik

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee rules them all.
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee is the best. Had to buy this for a one time use of drilling 4 holes. I haven't used it again, but it will do the job the next time and the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work just fine, you have a good day now, ya here.
customer_reviews.author: Old Bob

customer_reviews.title: Quality battery powered tool
customer_reviews.text: Tool has a lot of torque and can get into tight places. Battery life is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing was great. I bought it to drill out a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was great. I bought it to drill out a couple of Ford Fe big block exhaust manifold bolts that broke off on the head. It fit perfect in between the head and the inner fender of the truck saving me from either pulling the inner fenders or worse pulling the engine out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Angelich

customer_reviews.title: be careful
customer_reviews.text: like but you have to watch or when you put a bit in it will burn your hand so turn down to 5 or 6 worked for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great right angle drill for your 18v Milwaukee kit
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for quite some time to add this to my drill kit box and glad to have it. Perfect for drilling or hard to reach areas.
customer_reviews.author: moda_way

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 90* drill, very powerful and comes in handy for those tight spots!
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe C.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: If it had a belt clip it would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would recommend them to any one
customer_reviews.text: The item was as exspected,and arrived extremely fast. would recommend them to any one!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Good price, fast shipping,reliable seller. I would buy again if I need to. The tool is very dependable and the price was right. I was looking for bare tool because I already had a band saw using the same battery and charger so I could share it.
customer_reviews.author: V. L

customer_reviews.title: but when in a tight spot it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get used that often, but when in a tight spot it works great.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome right angle drill.
customer_reviews.text: Great for all those tight fit places. Great power as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jawabba

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Lost our previous one. We replaced it with the same one as we were very happy with it. Still upset we lost the first one. Someone probably found it and is happy with it also.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: this is such a handy tool. It gets you into really tight places.there are places I drilled where it would not be possible to use a regular drill.love it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for tight places. Stalls out easy, needs more power.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to drill out a broken exhaust bolt on my truck. Job could not be done with a conventional sized drill. This saved the day for me and used the same battery as my other Milwaukee drill. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for running a kurt vise open and closed in a hurry
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: The tool is real good but arrived with a defective switch so had to ...
customer_reviews.text: The tool is real good but arrived with a defective switch so had to send for warranty repair even before I got to use it. After repair it works good.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Nyseth

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my shop to work on vehicles, the right angle works great when your in a tight spot.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Black

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wow this tool is impressive it's got weight to it not cheap plastic tons of torque..well made..
customer_reviews.author: steve d.

customer_reviews.title: great deal on a solid tool!
customer_reviews.text: can't beat this deal anywhere - comes in a bag, but big deal - you toss the packaging on any tool that doesn't come in a storage case. Works great with all my other M18 tools. This drill is variable speed - squeeze the trigger a little for slow speed, more for faster speeds. Not sure what tool that other reviewer was talking about. The built-in LED worklight is great to illuminate your work area.
customer_reviews.author: C. Amex

customer_reviews.title: Very Disapointed !!!
customer_reviews.text: I worked with it for maybe 3 hours, Just stopped working. Looks like it is issue with switch. Worst thing is that I can't return it because I do not live in USA. So disappointing. I thought that Milwaukee is good brand... I was wrong...
customer_reviews.author: Dragan P

customer_reviews.title: terrific tool
customer_reviews.text: I works better than I expected. It has plenty of power. I would certainly recommend it to anyone. I wish I had ordered it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: toolguru

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for tight places. lots of power. long run time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis French

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I don't need to use it that often, but when I do, I'm glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: no torque
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave it one star is because I like Milwaukee tools.. I bought this to drill holes in 2x4s to run wire (1/2" bit), it stalls out and shuts off at the sign of any stress.. not at all like their drill..
customer_reviews.author: keith woods

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee tools are the best.
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee is the best brand in my opinion for all power tools, they stand behind their products I have not had any problems with all the Milwaukee tools I own except for damage from dropping them but they handle repairs very well I will only purchase Milwaukee tools.
customer_reviews.author: az plumber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool when you have the need for a low clearance power drill.
customer_reviews.author: David J Malave

customer_reviews.title: Wish I owned it sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for building cupboards, was able to get to small places with this tool where a regular drill would not reach and lots of power. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Poitras

customer_reviews.title: Adequate......
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but no where near as much power as my 18v Milwaukee cordless traditional drill. Expected more torque.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Graham

customer_reviews.title: needs a bit of a re-design
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the same power as the "normal" drills it does the job when needed. I think Milwaukee needs to re-design the housing around the chuck; it becomes a "pinch point".
customer_reviews.author: John Nebelsiek

customer_reviews.title: One of the best drills around
customer_reviews.text: As a longtime tool freak who nonetheless buys for quality and bargain priceing, I can only extoll the many virtues of the Milwaukee angle drill. It's lightweight with plenty of heft to ensure full user control. Its lithium battery (with wonderful fuel gauge) holds a charge for months -- perfectly enabling the user to keep it at the ready without constantly recharging. Its power and the extent to which it continues to operate through a long series of tasks both contribute to an excellent user experience. We have a host of power tools from Milwaukee, Porter Cable, Craftsman, Dewalt and others, but this is one of our very favorite drills.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey E. Farance

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Great for hard to get areas. I plan on getting a stubby drill set too to go with it. Should make drilling holes in cabinets and on firewalls of cars alot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lason

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee M18 cordless right angel drill
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee is the way to go in my opinion. This drill has an electric clutch that works great. You can get this into places you never thought you could drill. Run time on these tools is also great and they charge quickly. I switched from Makita to Milwaukee over a year ago and have never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Field Servive Tech
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Perfect for close quaters. More torque than I had expected. A must have in any tool box. Battery life is great as well..
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: very handy and accessable tool
customer_reviews.text: it does what it was designed to do get into tight places and its a quality tool at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zawada

customer_reviews.title: waiting for manual
customer_reviews.text: still waiting for the manual which is to be mailed to me cannot give a positive revue until it arrives
customer_reviews.author: tomkat

customer_reviews.title: Older Milwaukee 18v batteries will not work
customer_reviews.text: This tool requires the new Milwaukee M18 battery. This tool will not accept your old Milwaukee 18 volt batteries such as the V18 lithium ion or the older 18 volt Ni-Cad batteies. Milwaukee recently changed the entire line of 18 volt cordless tools to a different battery design M18. Chargers are not interchangeable either for M18 or V18. So just be aware of this when you review the tool description. I decided to return the one I bought since I have no desire to invest in the newer design batteries or tools. All my Milwaukee 18 volt cordless tools use the older design V18 battery. BTW, tool is definitely made in China. Way to go Milwaukee.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Got it for one job, have used it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for one job, have used it for a couple dozen jobs in the last few weeks. never thought it would be so handy.
customer_reviews.author: NC-D8800

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 2615-20 Cordless M18 Right Angle Drill, Tool only
product_meta.description:
M18 RIGHT ANGLE DRILL TOOL ONLY. The product is easy to use. The product is durable. Product is shipped in bulk packaging.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The combination of a 3-3/4-Inch total head length and an integrated Electronic Clutch make the M18 Cordless Right Angle Drill the most compact 18V Right Angle Drill Driver in the industry. A 3/8-Inch Single Sleeve Keyless Chuck, extended multi-position trigger and up to 150 in-lbs of torque provide versatility, ease of use and power that is unmatched.
feature_bullets: The product is easy to use
The product is manufactured in China
Head length great for working in tight spaces, 3/8-inch single sleeve ratcheting chuck
Eleven settings and drill mode for complete control in fastening applications
Extended multi-position handle provides convenience and versatility
Built-in LED's illuminates work surface and indicate clutch out

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars282 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
